page.title: 17Life at Allcock's Farm, Wray
page.content: The morning starts at 6.30 for Thomas and David. They get up to milk the cows. Grandad helps. Grandma cooks bacon, eggs and fried bread. Outside, Grandad scoops the cream off the milk and gets a bucketful of milk. After breakfast Grandma cooks cakes and shortbread. I go out and play. Then Grandma peels the potatoes for dinner. We have chips, vegetables and cold meat and rice pudding. When we have finished, we do jobs like feeding calves, de-horning calves, letting the cows out, checking mole traps. Then we ride our bikes around the yard, and make a tent on the lawn. After tea, we play cards and do jigsaws. Grandad is usually at an auction. We have salad for supper. I wash the lettuce and cut the tomatoes. Thomas and David let out the cows. An hour later, we go to bed, and the adults at about 9.30.
